task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 75°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline to estimate height, so I will tilt up while keeping the building centered.
The target building is supposed to be ~75° to the east but I'm currently facing north, so I should rotate right toward east-southeast to bring the building back into view for height estimation.
To estimate the building’s total height I need the roofline and ground reference in one view, so I will tilt up slightly while keeping the facade centered.
The view has snapped back to north again, so I must rotate right to ~75° east to face the target building for height estimation.
I should now stop and provide a height estimate based on a typical 3-story institutional building scale (~3.5–4 m per story plus roof/parapet).
